item.title: Cristal add a quote by Jerry Seinfeld
item.description: "A bookstore is one of the only pieces of evidence we have that people are still thinking." -- Jerry Seinfeld

item.title: Cristal add a quote by Lenore Hershey
item.description: "Do give books - religious or otherwise - for Christmas. Theyâ€™re never fattening, seldom sinful, and permanently personal." -- Lenore Hershey

item.title: Cristal add a quote by Montaigne
item.description: "When I am attacked by gloomy thoughts, nothing helps me so much as running to my books. They quickly absorb me and banish the clouds from my mind." -- Montaigne

item.title: Cristal add a quote by Dorothy L. Sayers
item.description: "Books... are like lobster shells, we surround ourselves with 'em, then we grow out of 'em and leave 'em behind, as evidence of our earlier stages of development." -- Dorothy L. Sayers

item.title: Cristal add a quote by Charles W. Eliot
item.description: "Books are the quietest and most constant of friends; they are the most accessible and wisest of counselors, and the most patient of teachers." -- Charles W. Eliot

item.title: Cristal add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "The love of learning, the sequestered nooks, And all the sweet serenity of books" -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Cristal add a quote by Paxton Hood
item.description: "Be as careful of the books you read, as of the company you keep; for your habits and character will be as much influenced by the former as the latter." -- Paxton Hood

item.title: Cristal add a quote by Francis Bacon
item.description: "Read not to contradict and confute; nor to believe and take for granted; nor to find talk and discourse; but to weigh and consider. Some books are to be tasted, others to be swallowed, and some few to be chewed and digested: that is, some books are to be read only in parts, others to be read, but not curiously, and some few to be read wholly, and with diligence and attention." -- Francis Bacon

item.title: Cristal add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I cannot live without books." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Cristal add a quote by Henry Ward Beecher
item.description: "Books are not made for furniture, but there is nothing else that so beautifully furnishes a house." -- Henry Ward Beecher

item.title: Cristal add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Cristal add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "Books may well be the only true magic." -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: Cristal add a quote by Gilbert Highet
item.description: "Books are not lumps of lifeless paper, but minds alive on shelves!" -- Gilbert Highet

item.title: Cristal add a quote by Frank Crane
item.description: "A friend is someone with whom you dare to be yourself." -- Frank Crane

item.title: Cristal add a quote by Richard Bach
item.description: "Can miles truly separate you from friends... If you want to be with someone you love, aren't you already there?" -- Richard Bach

item.title: Cristal add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "This above all: to thine own self be true, And it must follow, as the night the day, Thou canst not then be false to any man." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Cristal add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "When it is dark enough, you can see the stars." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Cristal add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "Like and equal are not the same thing at all." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Cristal add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "Life, with its rules, its obligations, and its freedoms, is like a sonnet: You're given the form, but you have to write the sonnet yourself. - Mrs. Whatsit" -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Cristal add a quote by Walt Disney
item.description: "There is more treasure in books than in all the pirates' loot on Treasure Island and best of all, you can enjoy these riches every day of your life." -- Walt Disney

item.title: Cristal add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "In a library we are surrounded by many hundreds of dear friends imprisoned by an enchanter in paper and leathern boxes." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Cristal add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Cristal add a quote by Hugh MacLeod
item.description: "Your idea doesn't have to be big. It just has to be yours alone. The more the idea is yours alone, the more freedom you have to do something really amazing. The more amazing, the more people will click with your idea. The more people click with your idea, the more it will change the world." -- Hugh MacLeod

item.title: Cristal add a quote by Mary Louise Bean
item.description: "Everything in life is a mirror to show you yourself" -- Mary Louise Bean

item.title: Cristal add a quote by Mary Louise Bean
item.description: "Most people go through life like a dog in a library." -- Mary Louise Bean

item.title: Cristal add a quote by Mary Louise Bean
item.description: "Gifted people are frequently more child-like." -- Mary Louise Bean

item.title: Cristal add a quote by Mary Louise Bean
item.description: "No one grows out of the bogeyman, it just changes. " -- Mary Louise Bean

item.title: Cristal add a quote by Mary Louise Bean
item.description: "Poets are inventors because they create a new way of seeing." -- Mary Louise Bean

item.title: Cristal add a quote by Mary Louise Bean
item.description: "Imagination is memory rearranged." -- Mary Louise Bean

item.title: Cristal add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi
